item.title: Research
item.description: Research interests Most of my research is in Graph theory, but I am also very interested in problems lying at the intersection of graph theory and other areas. In particular, I like concepts related to geometric group theory, coarse geometry or topology. A few topics I (am trying to) work on: Cayley graphs, geometric group theory, canonical tree-decompositions, twin-width, universal covering, evasiveness of graph properties, fractional colouring of graphs, diameter-degree problem, group tilings.

item.title: Teaching (in french)
item.description: 2023-2024 Conception et Exploitation des Bases de Données Cours de niveau L3 Informatique. Cours de bases de données, qui fait suite à un premier cours en L2 de bases de données. TPs en SQL. Projet en SQL+Python. Responsables du cours: Mario Cortes-Cornax. 2022-2023 Operation Research Cours de niveau M1 Informatique. Chargé de TD. Responsable du cours: Nadia Brauner. INF303: Modélisation des structures informatiques Cours de niveau L2 Informatique.

item.title: Short CV
item.description: I obtained my master in fundamental computer science in 2019 at the ENS de Lyon (France). From September 2021 to September 2024, I was a PhD student in the Combinatorial Optimization team of G-SCOP laboratory in Grenoble (France), under the supervision of Louis Esperet, and the co-supervision of Stéphan Thomassé. I defended my PhD in Grenoble on the 9th of July 2024. I am now currently a postdoctoral research fellow supervised by Piotr Micek at the Jagiellonian university in Kraków (Poland)
